alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 2:58PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong outflow winds will impact portions of northeastern Douglas, northwestern Elbert and south central Arapahoe Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 257 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong outflow winds along a line extending from Castle Rock to Ponderosa Park, or along a line extending from 25 miles south of Denver to 52 miles west of Limon. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southern Aurora, Castle Rock, Parker, Franktown, Ponderosa Park and The Pinery. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County
